manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Z207 Bluetooth Computer Speakers Rich Sound at Your Desk Getting great sound at your desk has never been easier. Connect two Bluetooth wireless devices plus one wired device. Then play, pause, and switch between them with Logitech Easy-Switch technology.

Play. Switch. Keep Playing. Pair up to two Bluetooth devices and switch between them with Easy-Switch. Just pause one device, switch, and play from another—or connect one device through the 3.5 mm input.

Versatile Setup With multiple ways to connect, you can pair up to two devices via Bluetooth, and one through the 3.5 mm input. That’s three devices—and one amazing speaker—all seamlessly connected. Rich Stereo Sound 10 Watts Peak/5 Watts RMS power produces room-filling sound. Each speaker has one active/powered driver that delivers full-range audio and one passive radiator that provides bass extension. Easy Controls Easily access the Bluetooth pairing button, power, volume and the headphone jack located on the right speaker.

Compare Logitech Speakers Z207 Bluetooth Add to Cart Z130 Stereo Sound See Details Z200 Rich Stereo Sound See Details MX Sound Bluetooth Add to Cart Customer Reviews 4.4 out of 5 stars 6,353 4.4 out of 5 stars 13,785 4.4 out of 5 stars 11,116 4.2 out of 5 stars 843 Price $59.54$59.54 — — $179.80$179.80 Sound Quality Rich Clear Rich Premium Device connection Wireless/Wired Wired Wired Wireless/Wired Power/Watts 5W RMS/10W peak 5W RMS/10W peak 5W RMS/10W peak 12W RMS/24W peak 3.5mm device inputs 1 1 2 2 Bluetooth device connections 2 0 0 2 Headphone Jack Yes Yes Yes Yes On-speaker audio controls Volume control Volume control Volume + bass controls Volume touch control

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for laptop on AUX 3.5 mm jack AND another BlueTooth source (Google Nest Hub) at same time
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE: These are the best speakers at this price point you can buy. Do it. I just did my 3 tests: 1) Dvorak Piano Quartet in D major; 2) Kinks "To the Bone" version of "Lola" and; 3) Pink Floyd "Wish You Were Here". Tone, spatial BS..., whatever, these sound like music. Oh, the bass is lacking but, come on, look at the footprint. I don't know if you can DM here but if you buy these and don't like, I'd love to know.These are honestly very good. Nice to have the AUX 3.5 mm jack (patch cord included) to connect the laptop and Bluetooth for my Google Nest Hub. It plays both audio streams simultaneously with no mess and no fuss. Added the phone as a second Bluetooth source and I haven't quite figured out how to seamlessly switch between two BlueTooths using Logitech's "Easy‑Switch" technology but that is probably pilot error. Seems I end up disconnecting from one and connecting the Z207 to another in the phone's settings or the Google Home app as appropriate. No biggy. Awesome speaker solution even with my deficient operator skills. Sound is far more balanced (less tinny) than the laptop and the Google Nest Hub speaker. Built-in amp lets me fix low laptop volumes on some streamed content. I specifically looked for amplified speakers with a power brick and the AUX capability vs. a USB-only solution but that's just me. Your mileage may vary.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice desktop speakers.
reviews.reviewText: Really nice speakers for the money. Not super loud, but they're plenty powerful enough for a little Black Sabbath while doing Excel.Bluetooth is super easy to set-up. The wired sound is very good even with the enclosed cord.Not super bass heavy, or too muddy.My ears are happy with their 100-ish to 10K Hz output. (Your hearing and set-up may be better. )I'm using them on their side, doesn't seem to impair the sound.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good sound, good value
reviews.reviewText: Nice clean sound, no buzzing or feedback. Bottom end is a bit light and can get tinny when turned up, but overall, nice speakers. Look good, sound good, price is right. Nice features, especially the bluetooth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best bang for your buck
reviews.reviewText: I had a pair of Logitech Z200s for about 3 years and they rocked. They were loud, crisp, and clear. The other day they finally burnt out on me after 3 years of high volume usage so I immediately went online to replace them. That’s when I came across these Z207s, which are practically the same, however these new ones here just include bluetooth connectivity, but I wouldn’t recommend using it because it kind of muffles whatever you’re listened to and muddies the frequencies. Instead, use the aux cord provided in the box and just plug it into your headphone jack and make sure your speakers are plugged into a wall/outlet and boom. Loud, clear sound. For $60 don’t expect them to be as loud as a $100 set of speakers, but they get decently loud. Loud enough. I use these for causal listening and for making my own music to give you an idea. For $60, you cant go wrong with these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best product at price point
reviews.reviewText: Super quick delivery, 3 step installation, decent sound quality good product overall

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars these speakers great sound
reviews.reviewText: I love the sound , great looking .I got these for my computer and they are very well made and the sound is amazing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sounds good, but they auto-sleep if there's no input sound
reviews.reviewText: They sound good for the size (they fit under my monitor), and I like that I can plug my headset directly into them. The bad thing about them, is that they auto-sleep after a short period of time, and they need a certain threshold of audio input to wake back up. Couldn't figure out why my in-game audio in certain games would randomly cut out in quiet periods. Using a headset, there's also a lot of line hiss that I don't hear when I plug the headset directly into my computer.I've relegated them for occasional usage when I want to play something through speakers (they work fine for that), but won't be using them any longer as my primary sound setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best speaker for me yet
reviews.reviewText: I like how you connect to your computer with a jack. And it has volume button and it is loud as well. Easy to use.
Me gustaron por el precio, se escuchan muy bien y los materiales se sienten de buena calidad.

reviews.reviewTitle: Larger than expected but still very good
reviews.reviewText: They're decently clear, loud and have good sound. Great for the price. They're just a bit larger than I expected but that's on me, I didn't read the size before buying, just kinda figured "Oh these are probably computer speaker size" but nah they're a bit bigger. I haven't used the bluetooth for them even once, honestly, just finding out about that feature while writing this so I can't say anything about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: PLEASE READ: COREECTION FOR A MISLEADING REVIEW
reviews.reviewText: There is another highly rated review that claims 2 of the speakers is not functional and the product has placed 2 FAKE CONES at the bottom as they do not include a magnet.This is NOT TRUE as those are called PASSIVE RADIATORS, which operate by using air pressure from the other active cone.Please do not be misleaded by the other person who has not done proper research and has given a good product a bad review.
I gifted these, they seem to work great. They look like the photo and have all the features listed. Nice computer speakers.
